    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Author:
    Levi Paradis Notes for report: Replaced getWinsLossStats with getters for each win loss, and tie value

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addMailFromMember(int sender, ForthWord newMail)
      Saves a new value into this robot's mailbox the mailbox has a capacity of 6 If the mailbox is full or the robot is destroyed, it will return false
      Robot clone()
      used to make a copy of this robot that has all the same attributes, but shares the same stats object this is so that we can have multiple copies of the robot on different teams, but they all update the same stats
      void destroy()
      Destroys this robot Removes it's health, and animates it's destruction

             long serial,
             long health,

             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> words,
             RobotGameStats stats)
        this constructor will be called to create a robot. A robot can only be created if you know all of the information needed for the robot to run a match
        Parameters:
        robotName - Name of the robot
        serial - The robot's serial number
        health - The base health the robot starts with
        strength - The amount of damage the robot will do
        moves - The number of moves the robot can move in one turn
        vars - The list of forth variables
        words - The list of forth commands
        stats - An object that holds the stats for this robot. If it w

      • Robot

        public Robot(java.lang.String robotName,
             long serial,
             long health,
             int strength,
             long moves,
             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vars,
             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> words)
        Another constructor for if you know all of the base information for a robot, but are missing stats
        Parameters:
        robotName - Name of the robot
        serial - The robot's serial number
        health - The base health the robot starts with
        strength - The amount of damage the robot will do
        moves - The number of moves the robot can move in one turn
        vars - The list of forth variables
        words - The list of forth commands

        public void setTeamIDs(int teamNumber,
                       int memberNumber)
        The simulator will assign each robot a unique team number and member number. When a robot is assigned to a team, it will recieve these attributes
        Parameters:
        teamNumber - The number assigned to the team
        memberNumber - The number assigned to the robot

      • addMailFromMember

        public boolean addMailFromMember(int sender,
                                 ForthWord newMail)
        Saves a new value into this robot's mailbox the mailbox has a capacity of 6 If the mailbox is full or the robot is destroyed, it will return false
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the mail
        newMail - the new value to save to the mailbox
        Returns:
        whether the action succeeded or failed

      • popMailFromMember

        public ForthWord popMailFromMember(int sender)
                            throws ForthRunTimeException
        Pops a value off the robot's mailbox
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the mail
        Returns:
        ForthWord the top value stored in the mailbox stack
        Throws:
        ForthRunTimeException - an exception thrown by forth interpretor if runtime error occurs

      • hasMailFromMember

        public boolean hasMailFromMember(int sender)
        lets us know whether we have mail waiting from a specific sender
        Parameters:
        sender - the member number of the sender we are checking for
        Returns:
        a bool representing whether we have mail waiting

      • clone

        public Robot clone()
        used to make a copy of this robot that has all the same attributes, but shares the same stats object this is so that we can have multiple copies of the robot on different teams, but they all update the same stats
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a copy of the robot with the same stats object
